{{Infobox Website |name = MediaFire |logo = [[Image:MediaFire logo.png|250px]] |screenshot = [[Image:MediaFire screenshot.png|300px]] |caption = |url = [http://www.mediafire.com MediaFire.com] |commercial = Yes<ref>[http://www.mediafire.com/mediapro.php Media Fire Pro Information]</ref> |type = [[File Hosting]]/Sharing Service |language = [[English language|English]] |registration = Optional |owner = |author = |launch date = <!--{{launch date|2005|3|21}}???--> |current status = Active |revenue = |slogan = ''Free File Hosting Made Simple'' |alexa = {{decrease}} 66 ({{as of|2011|11|2|alt=November 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/MediaFire.com |title= Mediafire.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> }} '''MediaFire''' is a free file and image [[one-click hosting|hosting web site]] that started in 2006 and is located in [[Harris County, Texas]], United States. The domain ''mediafire.com'' attracted almost 60 million visitors annually by 2008 according to a [[Compete.com]] study.<ref>[http://siteanalytics.compete.com/mediafire.com?metric=uv Mediafire attracts almost 9m visitors online yearly]</ref>
== Features == Features of MediaFire include unlimited storage and a limit of 200 MB per file (4GB for Pro users and 10GB for Business users).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=7&nav=0 |title=What types of files can I upload to MediaFire? Support Center |publisher=Support.mediafire.com |date=2007-06-12 |accessdate=2010-09-01}}</ref> MediaFire does not enforce waiting times for downloads, limit simultaneous downloading, or set [[Bandwidth (computing)|bandwidth]] limits. However, it requires [[HTTP cookie|cookies]] to be enabled and a [[CAPTCHA]] if you download a file then re-download it.
In August 2008, the service began offering a MediaFire Pro ("MediaPro") service that added more features and removes some limitations. Pro users can upload encrypted [[ZIP (file format)|ZIP]] or [[RAR]] archives,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=46&nav=0,2|title=Why can't I upload password protected archives?|publisher=mediafire.com|accessdate=2009-02-02}}</ref> remote upload files, and browse the website without ads.
== Reception == ''[[PC Magazine]]'' named MediaFire both one of the "Top 100 Undiscovered websites" and a "Top Website of 2008".<ref>[http://www.pcmag.com/slideshow_viewer/0,1205,l=213934&s=25234&a=213919&po=93,00.asp Top 100 Undiscovered Web Sites - MediaFire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2328651,00.asp |title=The Top 100 Classic Web Sites - Apps and Services |publisher=PCMag.com |date= |accessdate=2010-09-01}}</ref> It has also been reviewed favorably by [[CNET]]<ref>[http://www.cnet.com.au/broadband/0,239036008,339287726,00.htm How to store your files online - Broadband<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and [[Lifehacker]]<ref>[http://lifehacker.com/software/file-sharing/share-any-size-file-with-mediafire-209772.php File Sharing: Share any size file with MediaFire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>. == Competitors == *[[RapidShare]] *[[Megaupload]] *[[YouSendIt]]
